words.definition: Camouflage is something used to hide people and things.
words.example: The green and brown camouflage was best used for hiding in forests.

words.definition: To contemplate something means to think about it.
words.example: Mark took a moment to contemplate the math problem before solving it.

words.definition: To contend with something means to struggle to overcome it.
words.example: Stacy had to contend with a learning disability throughout high school.

words.definition: A cot is a small portable bed.
words.example: At the camp, the boysâ€™ cabin was lined with cots.

words.definition: To enlist means to join the military.
words.example: In their final year at school, the students were asked to enlist in the military.

words.definition: A frontier is a border between two regions or countries.
words.example: A fence was built along the frontier where the river curved.

words.definition: A handbook is an item that gives specific information or instructions.
words.example: If you look at the handbook, it will tell you which wires to connect.

words.definition: If someone is hesitant, then they are not sure or slow in acting.
words.example: Though he knew the answer, he was hesitant to say it.

words.definition: If something is lush, it is full of healthy, green plants.
words.example: The jungle was filled with lush vegetation.

words.definition: Marrow is the soft substance inside the bones of animals.
words.example: The soup was made with beef marrow for extra flavor.

words.definition: An outfit is a set of clothes worn together.
words.example: She bought a new outfit for the party.

words.definition: A paw is an animal's foot that has claws or pads.
words.example: The bear left large paw prints in the snow.

words.definition: To quiver means to shake with small, quick movements.
words.example: Her voice quivered with fear.

words.definition: If something is splendid, it is very good or beautiful.
words.example: The view from the top of the mountain was splendid.

words.definition: To stray means to go away from the correct place or path.
words.example: The sheep strayed from the flock and got lost.

words.definition: If something is substantial, it is of great importance, size, or value.
words.example: The company made a substantial profit this year.

words.definition: A torch is a light that is held in the hand and has a flame or bulb.
words.example: He used a torch to see in the dark cave.

words.definition: A tract is a large area of land.
words.example: The farmer owned a large tract of land in the valley.

words.definition: A vigil is a period of staying awake to keep watch or pray.
words.example: The soldiers kept a vigil throughout the night.

words.definition: If someone is weary, they are very tired.
words.example: The weary travelers finally reached their destination.
